body.p:
Camp Nelson Ky
Feby 2nd 1864
Hon Thos. E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort.
Sir

Genl Boyle has asked of you my appointment as 1st Lieut in the 40th Regt. Ky Vols, and in telling me yesterday, that you first wished that Col True should second the application, suggested that a few lines from me might advance the matter. Capt Hall Chief Qr Mr at Camp Nelson has desired that the commission might be issued and I be detailed for Qr Mr's duty under him. I have had eighteen months experience in the Department under
General Burnside and am perhaps fairly qualified for such a position. If at all practicable, I respectfully request that the appointment which Genl Boyle has asked in my behalf, may be granted. Please respond an early day.

I have the honor to be Sir
Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Servant
T. A. Palmer

40
Camp Nelson Ky
2d Feby 1864
Palmer T. A.
Asks for a commission as 1s Lt in 40th Ky Inf upon the recommendation of Genl Boyle --
Answer that a recommendation of the Col. Comm'd'g is nesessary to get a commission.

Boyle
ans. 6. Feb
Recd A G O. 5 Feby 1864
